review_title: Carleton University: A Mixed Bag of Academic Opportunities
job_title: Community Engagement Associate in Ottawa, ON
pros: Strong academic programs: Carleton University offers a wide range of academic programs across various disciplines, including business, engineering, journalism, and social sciences. The university is known for its strong faculty and rigorous coursework, providing students with a solid foundation in their chosen fields. Research opportunities: Carleton is a research-intensive institution, providing students with ample opportunities to engage in cutting-edge research projects. The university has several research centers and institutes, fostering an environment of innovation and discovery. Co-op and internship programs: Carleton has a robust co-op and internship program that allows students to gain valuable real-world experience while still pursuing their studies. These programs provide students with a competitive edge in the job market and help them develop practical skills. Campus facilities and resources: The campus is well-equipped with modern facilities, including state-of-the-art libraries, laboratories, and sports facilities. Students have access to extensive resources, such as online databases, research materials, and academic support services.
cons: Limited campus social life: Carleton University has often been criticized for its relatively limited campus social life compared to some other universities. While there are student clubs and organizations, the overall social scene on campus may not be as vibrant as in larger institutions. Location: Carleton's location in Ottawa, Ontario, can be seen as a drawback for some students. Although Ottawa offers cultural and political opportunities, it may lack the hustle and bustle of larger urban centers. Additionally, the weather can be challenging, especially during the winter months. Class sizes and overcrowding: Some undergraduate classes at Carleton University can be quite large, resulting in limited individual attention from professors. This can make it challenging for students to have meaningful interactions and personalized feedback in certain courses. Limited course availability: While Carleton offers a broad range of academic programs, there may be limitations in terms of course availability and scheduling. Some students have reported difficulties in enrolling in specific courses due to limited sections or timing conflicts.

review_title: NOT a good workplace as it promoted
pros: 1. Knowing some nice people who are willing to give back to the community. 2. OK for work-life balance
cons: I genuinely don't know why Carleton is one of the Top 100 Canadian employers... The pay and this workplace are not worth your time

review_title: Secure job but lots of politics with a hierarchical structure.
pros: Job security, decent pay for someone with little education. Decent benefits. Bonus - free tuition for kids.
cons: Support staff are treated like peons and given no respect. Faculty think they are better than staff and pretend they believe that staff and faculty are equals. It's not true. Most departments have a clock in/clock out mentality and are scrutinized for everything. Can luck out and get a decent environment  but usually only in smaller departments. Because of all of this, low moral across the board with staff and high turnover. Union is horrible - keep people in positions who would be fired in any other circumstance. Most frustrating thing is nepotism - job descriptions ask for specific level of education OR equivalent. How do you categorize equivalent? Depends on who is on hiring committees. Super frustrating that you are helping students get bachelor or graduate degrees and the people dolling out the advice have never even been through the experience. If I was a struggling student and asked a staff what their education and they responded "none" or college certificate, I would question "what's the point" if I can end up with a decent paying job with pension and benefits?

review_title: Seems good, but I'm a grad student so this is based on that experience
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros:
-My supervisor is good
-health benefits
-located in beautiful Ottawa
cons: -Lots of weird union vs management vibes

pros: I find the flexible hours nice
cons: I think that unstructured is hard

pros: Great professors and academic environment! Many of my professor went out of their way to support my research visions.
cons: None, great work and academic experience overall.

review_title: Workload is either a trickle or a downpour
pros: flexible schedule, decent pay for work load
cons: professors can be difficult to work with

review_title: Good university if you know what you are looking for
pros:
Friendly environment
Highly equipped Labs
Nice campus
cons:
A few old and dark buildings
Less competitive

pros:
- fair pay 
- good colleagues 
- fun work
cons: - old school environment for young workers

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Good place for the students.
cons: The location is not very convenient or close to accommodation.

pros: Flexible, a good union, and lots of support
cons: Low Pay compared to other universities or tenured professors

pros: Supportive culture, helpful workforce, great tips
cons: shift hours were short sometimes

job_title: Residence Fellow/Teaching Assistant in Huntsville, AL
pros:
- Youthful work environment
- Looks good on the resume
- Work you can feel good about doing because it's contributing to the education experience of others
cons:
- When working as a TA supporting courses taught by contract instructors I was often frustrated because they were thrown into their position with little preparation and there was a lot of confusion
- When working as a residence fellow I often felt annoyed with the unnecessarily strict and subjectively evaluated programming expectations that didn't jive with the reality of the wants or needs of the students
- Sometimes the approach of the institution toward students, staff and faculty felt a little too profit-driven for a place of learning -- I felt the quality of the educational experience being provided by the school was sometimes compromised by the amount of students the school wanted to admit into its programs and residence buildings without the proper space, staff or resources to accommodate increased numbers (e.g. new residence buildings were built without new senior residents or onsite counselors being hired or cafeteria space being added)

pros: Very good pay; easy to get 'tenure; 'never have to work overtime; opportunities to study for second degree while you work; sabbaticals
cons: Poor staff relations, lack of staff diversity, intense politics, lack of motivation, consistently do not hire or reward creative employees. Focus is on trivialities and never big picture. Management makes all decisions, communication is lateral. Inward-looking, self-congratulatory culture ignores needs of clients. Old ways of doing things are duplicated for decades.. Little ability to affect change, standards/expectations of staff are low. Little interest or motivation to examine new technology or look critically at a situation drives away most talented. Bureaucracy crippling. You will be living in Ottawa and will find the city itself has same flavour.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros:
-Good pay
-Low stress work depending on course/Prof
-Flexible hours
-Good benefits
cons:
- Pay in comparison to Graduate students at Carleton doing the same job is around 45% less per hour
- Carleton is the 2nd lowest paying university in Canada and absolute lowest paying in Ontario for TA positions

review_title: Teaching Assistant - School of Computer Science
job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros:
+ reasonable autonomy
+ fair pay rate for undergrads
+ nothing better than seeing that "lightbulb" click when a student understands a tricky concept with your help
+ strong union with reasonable dues
cons:
- limited hours and placements available
- grad students are underpaid
- certain professors and instructors are hit and miss to work with

pros: manager gets resources needed, then stays out of the way so that professionals can get the job done right. No micromanaging!
cons: not in the top league as far as research universities go, so not much depth in terms of on-site collaboration, but so what- research is now global via the Internet, so this is no longer much of a hindrance

pros: Positive atmosphere, generous compensation and fantastic benefits! Nice to work on campus, lots of facilities and restaurants, beautiful parks and river around.  Excellent work and life balance. Serial healthy workplace award winner.
cons: Things progress a bit slowly, not much growth and development overall, a lot of mundane daily duties and paperwork. If you want to get experience quickly and gain more autonomy and responsibility, maybe opt for a private company that focuses on sales and growth. Succession planning is not the biggest strength.

pros: Extremely flexible, will always strive to work around a student schedule.  Co-workers are always amazing, social, and strive to create a real positive working environment.
cons: Short shift times.  Sometimes staff has to travel long distances to work only one hour to two hour shifts, this structure is not always worth the money earned when bus fare is taken into account.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros:
Great working environment
Great pay and benefits
Great management
Adjustable schedule, great for a part time student

Overall just a great experience
cons: The only possible negative experiences I've faced, was marking tests because most of the time marking takes longer than what I am actually getting paid for, but the great salary and benefits makes up for that!

pros: Carleton University has vibrant student-oriented atmosphere that encourages its employee and students to achieve excellence in the work they do. This comes from efficient and effective management and inter-department cooperation.
cons: Occasionally there was some disagreement between management and staff. The necessity of meeting certain targets and budget constraints seemed to be the source of unpopular management decisions.

pros: Some pros of working at Carleton University are that they have Flexible hours, good pay rate, leadership opportunities and has a very positive atmosphere
cons: I don't think that there are really that many cons about working at Carleton. I had a very good experience working there and met a lot of really great people

job_title: Undergraduate Recruitment Officer in Ottawa, ON
pros:
You get to travel, meet wonderful students and parents. Pays very well & great benifits. 
Alot of flexiblity you may work from home on some days.
cons: long days, If you have a family it may be difficult to travel. Alot of politics in the work place when it comes to moving up

pros: It was a part-time position that I got based on a good recommendation from my current supervisor at Carleton. The day started at 8:30ish and ended at around 4 or 5 pm. We received a lunch break at noon's and received free lunch! Overall, it was an alright minimum-paying job for a week.
cons: Super long days, can also be boring.

review_title: Overall positive experience even if the pay was a bit subpar
pros: Flexible schedule, on campus site so easy to get to classes from there, recommend it for students who have long gaps between classes and will be on campus anyways, payments were always on time
cons: The pay was a bit subpar, a certain lack of professionalism by coworkers and supervisors,  have to deal with disrespectful and entitled students

review_title: Part-time Summer job at Carleton University
pros: Great Management and feedback, flexible hours, access to university services, beautiful campus. Room for progress and promotion, career advice services and opportunity to learn more about university before attending it.
cons: Near minimum wage (but what can you expect from a part-time summer job anyway), Small team overloaded with work some times

pros:
Beautiful campus surrounded by the Redeau canal on one side and the Redeau river on the other side.
Flexible timing and supervisors who are mostly helpful.
cons:
A compact campus compared to other universities from the similar categories
The campus is someway detached from any major commercial location which limits the choice of food.

pros: many opportunities for advancement and other positions within the organization. Pay was alright but not that great. There are good union and health benefits in place for employees
cons: there can be red tape in getting certain things done. Be ready to do lots of follow up in order to advance certain courses.

review_title: Post doctoral fellow - Innovation Grant Writer
pros: I had a remote position, so I didn't have to Ottawa to work there.  I had a very exciting project to work on, so I was very motivated and working from home did make things easier for me.
cons: I would've like to be there so I could've communicated better and more often with my supervisor. He was a very busy person, so communication was difficult.

pros: It is a great environment to work in and it is so nice to start networking with special constables.
cons: There aren’t a lot except that it is a big company so you do get minimum wage but you will get a wage increase after you work for one year of a dollar

job_title: Teach Assistant (Systems Engineering) in Ottawa, ON
pros:
Lots of variety in courses taught.
State of the art equipment.
Lots of smart people to discuss ideas with.
Eagerness to improve.
cons:
Far from downtown.
The ME building is old and needs upgrades.
The transit system doesn't operate very well. Buses are always over capacity.

pros:
Nice environment. The experience depends on your supervisor though, but mine was good.
High TA hourly payments.
Good life/work balance
cons: Highest tuition ever! As an international student you have to pay more than $21,000 per year! If you can become domestic, like me, you then pay around $8,000 per year, which is a huge jump in a student's life!

review_title: Good work experience for a student
job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros:
- Flexible working hours to some extent
- Friendly professors and teaching assistants
- Decent benefits, especially for graduate students
cons:
- Bad work-life balance around midterms
- Low pay for undergraduate students doing to exact same job as graduate students

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros: Its nice to research and develop new and innovative ways to solve advanced engineering problems and to write publications. Yet at the end of the day you're dealing with academics, not the most exciting thing to do.
cons: Very monotonic most of the time, you're life becomes reading and writing papers.

pros: Strong work life balance. Healthy workplace activities are a great way to stay active while at work.
cons: Use contracts as main source of employees. Most people have to renew at least 3 contracts before moving to permanent

pros: Carleton University offer one of the best student to professor relation I have ever heard of.
cons: Could be considered as fairly small in comparison to sister school U of O. It is however very easy to get around the campus as a result of this.

pros: I am working on resource management in cloud computing area with my professor. The topic of my thesis is The Reactive Predictive Model for Resource Estimation.
cons: Everything is good at Carleton University. The environment is nice for doing research and the gym is really good. It is too cold in winter.

review_title: Great place for Carleton University students
job_title: Client Service Representative in Ottawa, ON
pros: Go to uni and work at the same place. Awesome environment, awesome people. Flexible hours - extremely helpful during school year.
cons: Hard to continue to full-time employment at the university because of how the school hiring procedures work. Preferences are given to union members.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros: Work in a lab teaching interesting topics
cons: expected to work more hours than paid for

job_title: Post Graduate Research Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros: very good, and easy to work and students are good here
cons: Can be more good if people pay attention to what they want in real life. No life for students

pros: As a TA, the pay is amazing. You get paid for 8 hours per week though you definitely don't work that much.
cons: They didn't have enough positions for undergraduate TAs when I was in my fourth year, so I was only a TA for third year

pros:
Flexible working hours
Carleton is a great place to work with lots of benefits such as health benefits
cons:
Not much to learn if  you are not into a good project
- people are doing things for the sake of doing something that sets them apart from others

job_title: Learning Center Scholar in Ottawa, ON

Good pay for a student job
Casual and supportive environment
Management actually listens to feedback
cons:
Dealing with students who simply expects you to teach them everything
Having to be on the top of ten first-year courses in addition to your own courseload

pros:
Most of the people with whom (professors) are very nice and flexible to work with as long as delivery schedule are met. 
Flexible office hour.
cons: The physical facilities e.g. office space for teaching assistants (TA) are not so good.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros: It all depends on what prof you have and what course it is. But usually it is not a lot of work and you get a decent pay.
cons: Sometimes TA work interferes with your own school work, which sometimes might put you under pressure.

pros: Friendly , fun, picturesque location.
cons: Need more events for staff to get to know each other and to have more back up support then having one of situations.

review_title: Gained valuable experience working as a CSTAC TA!
pros:
You learn the material better when you are teaching.
Good pay for a Bachelor's Comp. Sci. student.
cons:
Little time to prepare for office hours for five courses (CSTAC TAs only).
SOME professors do not collaborate with the TAs enough.

pros: Generally very good working conditions. A friendly environment, and an overall easy-going position.
cons: Variables make a difference, such as course and instructor. Some instructors ask much more of their TA's, though most of the time they are considerate of the TA's other obligations.

job_title: Student Services Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros: I love my team...very nice and accepting; such a great and inclusive environment and space. Very good management at Carleton - organized and on top of their work
cons: None...Love it. :) Very very very much

pros: good opportunities for personal growth;
cons: university administration difficult to work with - they can take 2 months reimbursing money that they over-charged students by mistake, but students are expected to provide that money within days

review_title: Good Place to Work Despite Labor Issues
pros: People are great. Nice campus with good amenities.
cons: Labor issues - management needs to get on board with this.

pros: salary and benefits, gorgeous location, a lot of opportunities for development and learning, and a beautiful scenery
cons: poor leadership, parking was too expensive, getting in and out of the campus each day was a nightmare and added to the commute

review_title: I am a PhD student in Carleton University
pros: It is  a really beautiful university. The  professors are really helpful to you for your study.
cons: There are too many students now. It is really crowd now everyday.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros:
Some instructors can accommodate a flexible schedule 
Duties reviewed by course instructor periodically, helps keep responsibilities clear
cons: Work load can be high, depending on course assignment. Time management is a key skill for this position

review_title: A great job - if you can get it
pros: Carleton is a flexible, intellectually challenging environment. As a professor, I'm well paid, and have great benefits. The students are awesome.
cons: Same downsides as any other university job.

job_title: Digital Communications Assistant in Ottawa, ON
pros: flexible scheduling, friendly environment, a great place to work part-time if a student

Industry connections

pros: It was very ideal to be  working on campus and getting to network with different professors  while in University.

review_title: Nice campus, busy and absent supervisors

cons: Communication between staff and management is sometimes lacking. Expectations could be unclear or contradicting. MY opinion is biased though, as I had only one supervisor.

pros: Being a teaching assistant is usually dead simple, and professors are usually very understanding of delays in marking.
cons: Pay is expectedly low. During midterm/exam season, the workload can be very stressful.

pros: Good opportunities available, career center is active
